abstract: Tells the view controller that the extension is about to transition to a new presentation style.
overview:
## Discussion

Override this method to update your extension’s layout while the extension is transitioning between the [doc://com.apple.messages/documentation/Messages/MSMessagesAppPresentationStyle/compact] and [doc://com.apple.messages/documentation/Messages/MSMessagesAppPresentationStyle/expanded] styles. The user can switch between styles by tapping the collapse and expand buttons in the Messages app.  You can also programmatically trigger a transition by calling [doc://com.apple.messages/documentation/Messages/MSMessagesAppViewController/requestPresentationStyle(_:)].

The system doesn’t call this method on a view controller that is presenting a live view in the transcript or input field—in other words, when the view controller’s [doc://com.apple.messages/documentation/Messages/MSMessagesAppViewController/presentationStyle] property is set to the [doc://com.apple.messages/documentation/Messages/MSMessagesAppPresentationStyle/transcript] value.

# willTransition(to:)

**Instance Method**

Tells the view controller that the extension is about to transition to a new presentation style.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func willTransition(to presentationStyle: MSMessagesAppPresentationStyle)
```

## Parameters

- **presentationStyle**: The new presentation style. For a list of possible styles, see [doc://com.apple.messages/documentation/Messages/MSMessagesAppPresentationStyle].

## Discussion

Override this method to update your extension’s layout while the extension is transitioning between the [doc://com.apple.messages/documentation/Messages/MSMessagesAppPresentationStyle/compact] and [doc://com.apple.messages/documentation/Messages/MSMessagesAppPresentationStyle/expanded] styles. The user can switch between styles by tapping the collapse and expand buttons in the Messages app.  You can also programmatically trigger a transition by calling [doc://com.apple.messages/documentation/Messages/MSMessagesAppViewController/requestPresentationStyle(_:)].

The system doesn’t call this method on a view controller that is presenting a live view in the transcript or input field—in other words, when the view controller’s [doc://com.apple.messages/documentation/Messages/MSMessagesAppViewController/presentationStyle] property is set to the [doc://com.apple.messages/documentation/Messages/MSMessagesAppPresentationStyle/transcript] value.



## Working with Presentation Styles and Contexts

- **presentationStyle**: The extension’s current presentation style.
- **requestPresentationStyle(_:)**: Asks the extension’s user interface to transition to the provided style.
- **didTransition(to:)**: Tells the view controller that the extension has transitioned to a new presentation style.
- **MSMessagesAppPresentationStyle**: Presentation styles that describe your iMessage app’s appearance.
- **presentationContext**: The context describing where your iMessage app is presented.
- **MSMessagesAppPresentationContext**: Presentation contexts describing where your iMessage app appears.
